data.title: Best place for a gourmet coffee
data.text: We've been there for a mid-afternoon coffee. I had a green tea. A large choice of loose-leaf teas and fresh ground coffees. Good service. Seats available. People talking instead of staring at a screen. Though a bit noisy, I really enjoyed having a break during our day of sightseeing.

data.title: Awesome coffee!!!
data.text: Always stop at Intelligentsia when I visit Chicago. The baristas here are amazing. They are actually real baristas and not Starbucks machines operators. Really good coffee and very cool atmosphere. Do yourself a favor and stop in for a cup. You won't be sorry.

data.title: Excellent Espresso and Coffee
data.text:
I swung by here with my wife on a walk to the Art Institute. I ordered a single origin espresso and a machiatto made with their Black Cat blend. Both were great. My wife ordered a latte and enjoyed it. I quickly finished my two drinks and asked for a brewed coffee recommendation. I ended up with an excellent pour over brew while my wife finished her latte. I won't go into tasting notes since I don't remember what the single origin for the espresso or for the pour over but I can say they were both some of the finest coffee I've had. 

Also, the service was friendly and efficient. It is evident that the baristas are well trained, knowledgeable, and highly skilled.

data.title: Great coffee
data.text: Lovely pastries, lattes, iced latte, almond and chocolate croissants. Great service. Well air conditioned on a hot, sticky day in Chicago. More expensive than competitors, but, the coffee tastes better to me.

data.title: Wow, Truly the Best Coffee!
data.text: Great coffee served in a very stately but comfortable shop in the ground floor of the Monadnock Building.  My wife and I both had lattes, served to go, cuz we thought we were in a hurry, they we sat down and drank a sip. No kidding, it was the best latte ever! Wow, we did have time to linger!  We could have had it in a real cup--our bad. But truly, the best coffee I have ever had!

data.title: Cream of crop!
data.text:
Our son runs 3rd wave coffee shop in Tennessee. We know our coffee--and this is one of the best. So, let's start with the coffee. Fair trade and sustainable. Great selection of geographies. Roasts were perfect. 
Now, service. Wow! Very efficient. Got to us quickly, easy check out. My pour over was fantastic. Wife felt her latte was one of best she ever had.

data.title: Friendly service, good coffee
data.text: I go here because I love the Monadnock building... BUT coffee and service are great, the place is nice and clean. A wonderful break. I'd love to see more electrical outlets, please. Thanks!

data.title: Best Coffee in town
data.text: Been here lots but never reviewed. It is time to do so.  Best coffee in town and in many towns for that matter.  Wish it were in my town but alas, have the same old, same old coffee chains.  they are good enough but not this good.  Pastries ain't bad either I'd say.

data.title: Best coffee in Chicago!
data.text: Dare I say this spot serves the best cup of coffee in Chicago.....YES!! Hip and knowledgeable baristas, cozy atmosphere, velvety smooth coffee, what's not to love.

data.title: Perfect coffee!
data.text: Highly recommended for coffee lovers.  My daughter had a latte and loved it.  Cool atmosphere, good location.

data.title: Fabulous coffee
data.text: The lattes here are spectacular. I didn't try them but the pastries and croissants looked really superb as well. Highly recommend if you're a coffee snob.

data.title: A reliable favorite
data.text: I first visited Intelligentsia Coffee 5 plus years ago on a business trip to Chicago. I was thrilled to see they were still in business, and even more happy to say they were as good or better than I remembered.

data.title: Exceptional Coffee
data.text: Intelligentsia consistently makes good coffee. I know it from New York and it was no different in Chicago. Polite and knowledgeable baristas.

data.title: Average coffee
data.text: Not worth the high rating but alright place for a coffee, cookies were good, Starbucks lattes are much better, but overall was ok

data.title: Best Coffee in Chicago
data.text: One of the best coffee experiences I've ever had! They take time and care with each cup and the result is delicious! A huge leap up in quality from your Starbucks/Dunkin' Donuts brew.

data.title: Awesome coffee
data.text:
I really like coffee. I need coffee. 

I was browsing in Chicago trying to find a real coffee not from capsule, not served too hot etc. I was almost desperate when decided to give a chance to this coffeeshop. 

The coffee is awesome. No wonder the place is really busy. 

The only thing I did not enjoy was their pastry. The almond croissant was too dry for my taste. Felt like it was there for at least couple days. But you can forgive everything for the coffee they do.

data.title: Great Coffee
data.text: A work colleague recommended Intelligentsia and he wasn't wrong. This place has become my local hang out for coffee! The barista makes exceptional coffee at a reasonable price, including the Australian 'flat white' which has been hard to find.

data.title: Windy City Cappuccino
data.text: Great Cappuccino!!  Spent a few days in Chicago and read reviews on Intelligentsia so thought I would give it a try; (having lived in Italy for 15 months I can not drink 'bux)  OUTSTANDING cappuccino to say the least..!!  Also, I have been to some Coffee shops where only 'one' person knows how to make a good Cappuccino and everyone else just plays at making one.  Every Cappuccino I had here was world class... not to mention everyone was exceedingly friendly.  Nothing makes my day like a well made Cappuccino...thanks Intelligentsia.  One of the highlights for my first trip to Chicago.

data.title: Ultra friendly - great tasting coffee.
data.text: ExpensiveIsh but great all round. Clean, staff great and friendly, coffee and pastry very good. This location has limited hours but if you want something a bit different then the usual green and white cup, come here.

data.title: Deliciously intense coffee
data.text: I love going inside and just taking in the amazing coffee aroma! You can choose by regions of the world and intensity, and each one delivers it ! I also buy the brand to roast at home . Really good stuff.
